moves.1. e4 e5 2. Bc4 d6 3. Nc3 c6: This was an interesting move, I would think he would play Nc6.
moves.8. b3 b5 9. Be6: Getting my bishop in a really good spot.
moves.15... Qe7 16. Bxg6+: I gain a piece! were even!
moves.22... Bh6 23. d3 c5 24. Rab1 h4 25. Rb7: Bring my rook out and outpost it in my opponents territory
moves.27. f6 Rab8 28. a6 Rba8 29. Rb6 Rhf8: have my pawns up and ready to promote some time soon!
moves.33... Ra8 34. Rxd6+: my attack is complete, I gain a pawn.
moves.37... Kf6: Now why didn't he take on a2??
moves.38. a3 Rc6 39. Bb4 Ra6 40. Bc5 Rc6: He attacks my bishop again and again!
moves.42... Kg6 43. Bd6 Rxc4 44. e6: I have a file all to myself!!
moves.44... Rc8 45. e7 Kf7: Prevents me from getting a queen so I will just force him to trade with me!
moves.46. e8=Q+ Rxe8 47. Rxe8 Kxe8 48. a4 Bf8: I have the upper hand now!
moves.49. Bxf8 Kd8 50. a5 Kc8 51. Bd6: I have a definite advantage now!
moves.51... Kb7 52. f4 Kc6 53. a6 Kb6 54. fxg5: I have a file down the board for my pawn to promote to.
moves.54... Kxa6 55. g6 Kb6 56. g7 Kc6 57. g8=: I have a queen now and all hope for black is lost!
moves.58. g3 hxg3 59. Qxg3+ Ke6 60. h4: Black resigned here but it was a good game!
